meanings.definition: To give a name to at baptism.
meanings.sent1: The priest christens the baby with holy water.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered at the church to christen the newborn.
meanings.sent3: The baby giggled as the priest christened him, thinking it was a game.
meanings.sent4: The baptismal water christens the child's soul with purity.
meanings.sent5: The act of christening symbolizes a new beginning in the child's life.

meanings.definition: To dedicate or bless by a religious ceremony.
meanings.sent1: The bishop christens the new church with a special service.
meanings.sent2: The priest will christen the couple's marriage with a blessing.
meanings.sent3: The church mice were surprised when the priest christened them for good luck.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streaming through the stained glass windows christens the altar with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sacred ritual of christening brings divine grace to the believers.

meanings.definition: To name or dedicate something informally or formally.
meanings.sent1: The children christen their treehouse 'Fort Adventure'.
meanings.sent2: The sailors will christen the new ship with a bottle of champagne.
meanings.sent3: The cat christens the new couch by claiming it as her favorite napping spot.
meanings.sent4: The artist christens her latest masterpiece 'Eternal Beauty'.
meanings.sent5: The community will christen the new park in honor of a local hero.
